alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 7:26AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dale and Coffee Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 725 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brantley to near New Brockton. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elba, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, New Brockton, Ariton, Lee, Pine Level, Mixons Crossroads, Carl Folsom A/p, Dill, Hooper Stage Field, Turner Crossroads, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Mabson, Clintonville, Wise Mill, Roeton and Dale County Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama.
